text: Is there a way to guarantee that default content will appear editable on the production site? For context, in my current state, content shows up but the module fields are blank.
(I can't find the original discussion about this so posting again)
WHOA! this is fixed now all of a sudden...
Thanks HubSpot? I'm pretty sure I didn't do anything to fix it...

Wasn’t me.





(joking but also telling the truth. Not aware of any changes going out regarding this)
I know <@U38EZFVFE> was having this issue and mentioned it's a known thing. <@U38EZFVFE> does it "fix itself" for you too?
Got it, thanks. I haven't tried it yet but it feels like I need to soon.

<@U7SL518D6> the instructions for creating a child theme using the CLI are unclear to me. Do I need to copy the parent theme and then modify the theme.json (the instructions never say to copy the parent theme but that's the only way this makes sense to me)
ooh, or is it literally just a theme.json file and I need to recreate the parts that are different?

Think of the child theme as it’s own theme. A theme requires a theme.json file within a theme folder. (just a normal folder that contains a theme.json)

Because this theme is an extension of a parent theme, you add to your theme.json the extends statement.

Done. You have a child theme.

Anything you add to the child theme that matches a file name from the parent theme will override the parent theme’s version.
